meanings.sent1: She kept misaltering the recipe, which resulted in a burnt cake.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was misaltering the document and quickly corrected his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The robot misaltering its programming led to a hilarious dance routine.
meanings.sent4: Her misaltering of the painting turned it into a masterpiece of abstract art.
meanings.sent5: The magician's misaltering of the card trick left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The act of changing something in a mistaken or improper way.
meanings.sent1: The misaltering of the contract caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the misaltering of the design and requested a revision.
meanings.sent3: The misaltering of the play script turned it into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The misaltering of history books can lead to misunderstandings about the past.
meanings.sent5: The misaltering of the map led the travelers astray.
